title: Anti-flu antibodies can inhibit two different viral proteins

title_detail.value: Anti-flu antibodies can inhibit two different viral proteins

summary: Researchers have discovered that antibodies that may form the basis of a universal flu vaccine inhibit a second viral protein in addition to the one that they bind. The study reveals that antibodies that recognize the viral surface protein hemagglutinin can also inhibit the viral neuraminidase, and that this enhances antibody neutralization of the virus and the activation of innate immune cells with anti-viral activity.
